chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is an 18-year-old female with acute EBV infection presenting with thrombocytopenia. Liver biochemistry showed elevated aminotransferases: AST up to 134 U/L and ALT up to 292 U/L, with normal bilirubin levels. The table provides peak values: ALT 292 U/L, AST 134 U/L, ALP 82 U/L, GGT 63 U/L, and LDH 365 U/L. Bilirubin is normal, not specified. INR and albumin are not mentioned. The clinical outcome is improved/discharged with complete normalization of blood counts and liver enzymes during outpatient follow-up.
